numbered_ace_sentences: 1. A legacy applicant is more likely to get into an Ivy League university.
2. I wonder why a poorer person cannot get into an Ivy League university in an easier way.
3. A rich person can get into an Ivy League university in an easier way.
5. A person can come from a small town.
6. A person from a small town can have very good test scores.
7. A person from a small town can still not get into an Ivy League university.
8. A person from a small town can have a harder time getting into an Ivy League university.
9. This can happen because the person does not have a legacy at the school.
